result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Blanchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Per Judicial authority, posted cash bond applied. Costs paid in full.

Conditions: Become involved in counseling program as soon as possible. Successfully complete anger management & domestic abuse counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted under jail rules, includes treatment. 


Unpaid costs converted to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 5-31-16; unpaid supervision fees of $677.35

Cases called: 16CF164 & 14CF327, Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 16CF164, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information - reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 30 days jail. Huber granted for work and treatment. Jail is consecutive to 14CF327. $618 costs, submit DNA sample. No jail credit. Cts. 1&3 read in and dismissed. In 14CF327, Court imposed 9 months jail, commence now. Huber granted for work and treatment. 148 days jail credit. Unpaid costs converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Attorney Appointed Tristan Eagon
filed by Probation Agent Erin Graf

Cases called: 14CF289, 14CF402, 14C327, 14CF328,  Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody, with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI addressed. Sentencing statements made by the parties. Court addressed defendant regarding sentencing.  In 14CF289, Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 3 yrs. probation, conds: 1 year jail - serve six months, starting 9/1/15. Huber granted for work and counseling sessions. Remaining six months stayed - to be used at agent's discretion. $618 costs, Further conds: Become involved in counseling program as soon as possible. Successfully complete anger management & domestic abuse counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. (3 days jail credit).  In 14CF327, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds. as in 14CF289 with exception of jail and DNA sample, $543 costs. (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF328, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327, $618 costs (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF402, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327 $618 costs (9 days jail credit).
Sentencing hearing on June 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
filed by defendant/counsel

Cases heard: 14CF289, 14CF327, 14CF328, 14CF402, Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waivers of Preliminary Hearings filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Informations filed. In 14CF327 & 14CF328, Atty. Klopp motioned for reduction of cash bonds and removal of no contact with E.U. Statement given by victim. DA Kohlwey objected to motion. Court amended bonds to $2,000 each case, with prior conds., for a total of $4,000 No contact continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Atty Roger Klopp

Cases heard: 14CF327 & 14CF328, Defendant, Justin D Blanchard, appeared with Atty. Brian Severson, special for public defender office. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2,500 cash bond in each case, total $5,000 cash bond with felony conds. and no contact with E.U., her residence, workplace or her children, absolute sobriety at all times.
